titleStmt.title: Letter from Alice Culler Neihardt to Enid Neihardt, August 5th 1929
titleStmt.author: Neihardt, Alice Culler

publicationStmt.authority: The Papers of John G. Neihardt

distributor.name: Center for Digital Research in the Humanities

bibl.title: Letter from Alice Culler Neihardt to Enid Neihardt, August 5th 1929

msIdentifier.repository: John G. Neihardt Center Research Library, Aly Collection

div1.note:
taped on, not sure if it's an envelope or not
Fine Collection August 5, 1929 44 676 After...........days, return to neihardt 507 North Clay KIRKWOOD, MO. SAINT LOUIS, MO.5 AUG 6 930 AM 1929 ADYOUSTRENUM Miss E.V. Neihardt Box 255 Branson, Mo. Janay County.
div1.p: Your dear letter just came and made me think of how many times you and I used to think the same thoughts For 9 had been planning to send a watermelon in the car!-But the Kroger man tells me they are high and the reason about over-so I don't know whether I can get one IV the time Daddy leaves here. - Thank

God we have had a break in the weather and it is wonderful and cool. It was about necessary that it should become cooler for Daddy's dear dake. he has been coming out on the street car around 3 o'clock when his office as unbear-ably hot with its huge window exposed to the Sure! Enid dear, does love you, dear,

out you seemed to take her efforts to influence you to be more thought-ful of "me"! and more orderly in your house work, - and that disappointed her very much - However she has done many nice things for you, and if you love her enough, she will forget all that she disliked, and be ready to love you as always. She needs your love, my love everybody's love worse

than any person I know, in spite of her material comforts - and Enid you can never love too much So don't about your.self, but just write her that you do hope she will have a lovely trip and that you love her, and hope she loves you too - and yours message will go right to a very lonesome, tender heart. She wrote you and me about your photograph,

Enid dear, and I did not tell you because I was afraid it might make you feel bad. She did not like it of you, said it did not do you justice, that it did not give a fair im-pression of you - so I sent her the front view instead and she liked it a lot bet-ter. So does Daddy, by the way I asked her to return the other picture, which she did and I have now sent it

to Mrs Hays. Do you want to give one to Mis Garner? I can get you an other front view if you want me to. What did Lee say about your picture and hunt Grace?? Daddy is sending Amamma some books to read on the steamer. He seemed to want to do this, and I am so

glad. enid dear I am go-oing to get you to take care of Daddy's B.U.D.s and his 2 shirts turn down collars attached. you must rinse them out and keep one ready for him to put on every day, will you dear? They are better than the right detachable collars - and he looks nicer in them and feels easier - So please do
not forget! I am so anxious to hear how Alices' birthday turned out and all about her birthday. Will get a Brassiere, am sorry I forgot dear -

closer.note: dear we have not been surviving - nor anything else!
